get.summary: OpenAPI description (this document)

patch.summary: Order in which the AI believes the user should review papers.

get.summary: Given a specific review, the view returns the most recent label from each source type, for each paper

delete.summary: Original entries for papers uploaded by user. Can be used to generate an export.

patch.summary: Original entries for papers uploaded by user. Can be used to generate an export.

get.summary: Whether to include a paper in a specific review, as labeled by different sources (human, model, oracle, etc.).

get.summary: Jobs that are created for the AI worker(s).

post.summary: Jobs that are created for the AI worker(s).

delete.summary: Jobs that are created for the AI worker(s).

patch.summary: Jobs that are created for the AI worker(s).

get.summary: Whether a paper meets a criterion in a certain selection, as set by different sources (human, model, oracle, etc.).

post.summary: Whether a paper meets a criterion in a certain selection, as set by different sources (human, model, oracle, etc.).

delete.summary: Whether a paper meets a criterion in a certain selection, as set by different sources (human, model, oracle, etc.).

patch.summary: Whether a paper meets a criterion in a certain selection, as set by different sources (human, model, oracle, etc.).

get.summary: Reviews that users can create and manage.

post.summary: Reviews that users can create and manage.

delete.summary: Reviews that users can create and manage.

patch.summary: Reviews that users can create and manage.

get.summary: Organizations that users belong to.
Roles assigned to users. At least one of the columns organization_id, review_id, selection_id must be filled.

post.summary: Roles assigned to users. At least one of the columns organization_id, review_id, selection_id must be filled.

delete.summary: Roles assigned to users. At least one of the columns organization_id, review_id, selection_id must be filled.

patch.summary: Roles assigned to users. At least one of the columns organization_id, review_id, selection_id must be filled.

get.summary: This view is used to display the papers in the selection with their labels

The best label is selected according to the following logic: 1. Human labels are preferred over model labels 2. Labels are ordered by source (human, oracle, model) 3. If the top source has multiple labels, the most recent one is selected. Given a specific review, the view returns the most recent "best" label for each criterion for each paper
Determination which papers should be included, based on the review criteria. Reviews can have multiple selections. Selections always regard all papers in a single review.

post.summary: Determination which papers should be included, based on the review criteria. Reviews can have multiple selections. Selections always regard all papers in a single review.

delete.summary: Determination which papers should be included, based on the review criteria. Reviews can have multiple selections. Selections always regard all papers in a single review.

patch.summary: Determination which papers should be included, based on the review criteria. Reviews can have multiple selections. Selections always regard all papers in a single review.

get.summary: App users. Referenced from auth.users. Users can set their own first_name and last_name, but no other user data.

delete.summary: App users. Referenced from auth.users. Users can set their own first_name and last_name, but no other user data.

patch.summary: App users. Referenced from auth.users. Users can set their own first_name and last_name, but no other user data.

get.summary: Given a specific review, the view returns the most recent label from each source type, for each criterion for each paper

If the top source has multiple labels, the most recent one is selected. Given a specific review, the view returns the most recent "best" label for each paper

rowFilter.criteria.rule.name: rule
rowFilter.criteria.rule.description: Inclusion criterion as initially given by the user. E.g. "Healthy male adults 18-30 years"

rowFilter.criteria.instructions.name: instructions
rowFilter.criteria.instructions.description: Longer instructions of the criterion. Can be used by the LLM oracle to generate synthetic data.

rowFilter.uploaded_entries.original_file.description: File type where the entry originated. Defines which keys are expected in the content.

rowFilter.uploaded_entries.content.description: JSON parsed entry of the paper.

rowFilter.paper_labels.label.description: Label set by the source. Any source other than "human" should not predict "doubt".

rowFilter.paper_labels.source_details.description: Details of the source. E.g. { model_type: "SoftMin", model_version: "1.0" }

rowFilter.paper_labels.motivation.name: motivation
rowFilter.paper_labels.motivation.description: Motivation for the label. Usually when source is "oracle".

rowFilter.jobs.job_data.description: Data for the job. E.g. { selection_id: uuid }

rowFilter.jobs.picked_up.description: Filled if a worker has picked up this job. E.g. { worker_id: text, started_at: timestamp }

rowFilter.jobs.results.name: results
rowFilter.jobs.results.description: Results of the job. Only filled if the job is finished. E.g. { comment: text, updated_at: timestamp, worker_id: text }

rowFilter.criterion_labels.label.description: Label set by the source. Any source other than "human" should not predict "doubt".

rowFilter.criterion_labels.source_detail.description: Details of the source. E.g. { model_type: "Transformer", model_version: "1.0" }

rowFilter.criterion_labels.confidence.name: confidence
rowFilter.criterion_labels.confidence.description: Confidence of the source for the prediction. Usually only set when source is "model".

rowFilter.selections.selection_type.description: Type of selection. E.g. "offline", "comparative", null. This is set by us and used for internal purposes.
